title: Four years ago, the ages of R and S were in the ratio of 5:6 respectively. Eight years from now, the respective ratio of their ages will be 8:9. What is the sum of their age at present? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends…! Four years ago, the ages of R and S were in the ratio of 5:6 respectively. Let the present ages of the two be R years and S.years Four years ago their ages were R- 4 and S - 4. The ratio of their ages was 5:6. Accordingly (R - 4)/(S - 4) = 5 / 6 Criss multiplication 6 (R - 4) = 5 (S - 4) 6R - 24 = 5S - 20 6R = 55 + 24 - 20 6R = 5S + 4 Multiplying the equation with 3 18R = 15S + 12 …Eq..1 Eight years from now, the respective ratio of their ages will be 8:9. Eight years from.now their ages will be R + 8 and S + 8. Their ratio will be 8/9 (R + 8): / (S + 8) = 8 / 9 Criss multiplication 9 (R + 8) = 8 (S + 8) 9R + 72 = 8S + 64 9R = 8S + 64 - 72 9R = 8S - 8 Multiplying the equation with 2 18R = 16S - 16 …Eq..2 Equating Eq..1 and Eq. 2 15S + 12 = 16S - 16 15S- 16S = —16 - 12 —S = —28 S = 28 years Substituting the value of S in Eq..2 18R = 16S - 16 18R = 16 × 28 - 16 18R =.448 - 16 18R = 432 R = 432/18 R = 24 years Thus present age of R is 24 years and present age of S is 28 years . Sum of their ages = 24 + 28 = 52 years Answer: Present age of R is 24 years and present age of S is 28 years and sum of their present ages is 52 years

Let Present ages be R and S respectively 4 years ago : (R-4)/(S-4) = 5/6 …… (1) 8 years from now: (R+8)/(S+8) = 8/9 ….. (2) Required sum of their present ages … i.e (R+S)  Resolving (1): 6*(R-4) = 5*(S-4) or 6R -24 = 5S -20 or 6R = 5S+4 or R = (5S+4)/6 … (1a)  Resolving (2): 9*(R+8) = 8*(S+8) or 9R + 72 = 8S + 64 or 9R =8S-8 or R =(S-1)*(8/9) ….. (2a)  combining equations (1a) and (2a) to eliminate R R= (5S+4)/6 = (S-1)*(8/9) or (5S+4)*(9/6) = (S-1)*8 or (5S+4)*9 = (S-1)*8*6 or 45S + 36 = 48S -48 or 48+36 =3S or S= 28 …. (3) Substituting S=28 into equation (1a) in order to solve R R= (5*28+4)/6 or R = 24 … (4) Therefore sum of Present ages (R+S) = 52 (ANS)

Let the present ages of the two be R and S. (R-4):(S-4) = 5:6, or 6(R-4) = 5(S-4), or 6R-24 = 5S-20, or 6R = 5S+4, or 18R = 15S+12 …(1) (R+8):(S+8) = 8:9, or 9(R+8) = 8(S+8), or 9R+72 = 8S+64, or 9R = 8S-8, or 18R = 16S-16 …(2) Equate (!) and (2) 15S+12 = 16S-16, or S = 28 At present, R = 24 and S = 28. and the sum of their ages is 52. Though not asked in the question: The sum of their ages 4 years ago was 44 and 8 years from now the sum would be 68. The ratio of the sum of their ages 4 years ago to now and 8 years from now will be 44:52:68 or 11:13:17

Let the ages of R and S be a and b respectively. So, their ages: 4 years ago were (a - 4) and (b - 4) respectively and as such, the ratio was: …………………………………………….. (a - 4)/(b - 4) = 5/6 … (1)8 years from now will be (a + 8) and (b + 8) respectively and as such, the ratio will be: …………………………… (a + 8)/(b + 8) = 8/9 … (2) Solve (1) and (2) simultaneously, you get: a = 24 and b = 28 Therefore:The sum of the two ages now is: a + b = 24 + 28 = 52 To check these results: (24 - 4)/(28 - 4) = 20/24 = 5/6 and (24 + 8)/(28 + 8) = 32/36 = 8/9

Four years ago, if age of R was 5x, age of S was 6x. Their present ages are 5x+4 and 6x+4 respectively. Eight years from now their ages will be 5x+4+8 and 6x+4+8 . Therefore 5x+12 : 6x+12 = 8:9. Or 45x + 108 = 48x + 96. Or 3x = 108 - 96 = 12. Or x = 4. Therefore their present ages are 5x+4 = 24 years and 6x+4 = 28 years. Sum of their ages will be 24+28 = 52 years.
